result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J Uhrmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Count 5 and any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.
Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Obtain a High School diploma.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with Jessica P, her family or her residence. DNA Specimen waived based on date of violation. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Write a letter of apology to the victim. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Case 15CT018 was dismissed and read in.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 131 days were granted.

Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 6/16/16.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ryan J Uhrmann in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and Count 5.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 are dismissed and read in.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #5: 

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 131 days)
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  6 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  Jessica P., her family or her residence.
*DNA sample/surcharge waived based on date of violation. 
*Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. 
*Write letter of apology to the victim.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.

COURT COSTS:  $253.00 (appy cash bail);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Count #1:
    The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT; (consecutive to Count #5 and any other sentence);
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S); 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
same as count #5

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (apply cash bail);
DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00(apply cash bail and balance to be refunded to poster);


IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
